values:
First off, its been far too long, I know.  I'm trying to get back into things by making sure I update AT LEAST once a week.  I have a blog now, focusing on my life as a stay-at-home father.  that can be read here courtjester138.wordpress.com  

Right now the girls are out of school for summer vacation and I am full-time caregiver to a 10 month old baby. My biggest challenge with this is that my girls always wanna go do something; hit the zoo, the science center, a park, go swimming, etc.  And really, who can blame them? No one wants to be stuck at home all summer long.  The hardest part is trying to balance keeping them happy and making sure the baby is well cared for and happy as well.  

My sister, her husband, her teenage daughter, and her 6 year old will be here for a week later this month.  that will surely add an interesting dynamic to the whole thing.  I'm hoping it will make things a bit easier, at least as far as entertaining the girls is concerned.  

Well, her parents are coming over in a bit and I still have a little house work to do, cuz that is my life now.

The baby was born a bit ago (27 days ago).  His name is Thomas Joseph and he was born the day after my birthday.  The past month has been pretty much all about him.  Every time I think we're settling into a routine, he goes and changes things up.  Right now, for example, he's going through some growth spurts and is cluster feeding a lot.  That keeps us up at night more.  I'm tired all the time these days.  I love him, but I wish I could go hang out with a friend or something.  That's another thing.  I get very little free time, and when I do that boy won't even answer his phone.  That gets annoying a bit.  He's been acting a lot strange lately.  I wish he'd tell me what's up.  

I guess that is all I can think of right now.  I'd say that I'll be better about not taking so long to post in the future, but I have said that before and I still tend to forget.  I'll try, but I make no guarantees.

So it's been a long time.  Lets see.  Still doing the watch the kids and school thing.  I wanna change my major, but is it too late?  Melissa is pregnant, due in August.  It is a boy, as the ultra sound has shown us twice.  We still don't have a name for him yet.  After summer, life will change a lot.  I'll have a baby to care for, on my own a lot of the time.  Emily will be starting school.  That'll be strange.  It's been pretty much her and I for the past 4 1/2 years.  I'll miss her a bit, but I know she'll love Kindergarten.  I've got just a few weeks to clean out the baby's room and set up his furniture, before Melissa goes crazy.  That means cleaning out the shed, too, to make room for my drum set, which I'll never get to play again apparently.  Jon and I are still friends, but he doesn't call much since he started his new job, so that kinda sucks.  My car is broken down and Jon's dad's car is broken, so he uses Jon's car.  This all adds up to we don't hang out that often either.  AC is broken right now for me, too.  And it is very warm outside.  Could be a lot hotter, though, so I hope we get it figured out before those hotter temps arrive.  So that is all that I can think of right now.  Later.

Home:  Still watching the kids.  Same situation as last time.  They drive me crazy, but I like getting to spend the extra time with them.  

Work:  I don't know.  Jon told me a couple weeks ago it was pretty much over.  Now the place seems to be hanging in there, for now.  I'm thinking seriously about quitting, though.  Not because of pay or anything, not even really because of the place (except I'm tired of the hoodlums that frequent the place).  More because I think it's ruining Jon and I's friendship.  We never even talk anymore, let alone hang out.  Except at work, and I'm sorry, but that just doesn't count.  Could backfire, though.  Could make matter worse, me quitting.  I mean I'd give him the necessary notice.  Whatever, I don't know.  

School:  Got tough there in the middle of my two current courses.  Only got 2 more weeks in them, though.  I plan to make it through.  Although lately, I don't see the point.

Personal:  I've taken the attitude as of late of...f**k it.  I just don't give a s**t anymore.  I care about my kids and the people in my life (as few as there are) but for all else, f**k it.  

oh, an my Xbox is broken.  I sent it off for repairs.  Jon let me borrow his a week ago.  I'm giving it back to him tomorrow though.  Not because mine is back, but because, well...f**k it.

Work:  I work part-time now for Jon at his video store.  It's a tricky situation because he's trying to make it with his own business.  I feel like my working there is doing him more harm then good.  He'd never admit to that, but I feel like he's having troubles paying me AND making the bills.  I gotta have a job, though.  And I think he needs another employee other then himself.  So I guess we'll just see how it goes.

School:  I'm in school now, that's why the part-time job.  It's going pretty good.  I just finished my first two courses and got A's in them.  Just started my second two.  

Home:  We just got some bad news from the mortgage company.  The good thing is, we fight only occasionally now.  It's still about money mostly.  

Kids:  They are doing fine.  I look after the 3 year old all day; another reason for the part-time work.  The older one is doing good in school. 

Personal:  I been saving up for Guitar Hero World Tour, but now that I just got that news from the mortgage company, I'm going to have to use the GHWT money for that problem.  Guns N Roses have a new album.  There are a couple of good part of it, but it's not that great.  I still jam to Death Magnetic every chance I get.  I love it more and more each time.  

That's about it for now.

Let's see.
Work:  Still waiting on a driver position to open.  I've been told I'm "on a very short list" for getting my own route.  Hope it happens soon, or this family is gonna hit ROCK bottom...and soon.

Home:  Melissa and I have been at it lately.  Money issues, ya know.  Especially a little matter of I was pulled over for expired tags (which I had been fighting her about for some time now) and didn't have current insurance (another thing I'd been fighting her on).  Now I gotta have insurance straight through for 2 years or Im in big trouble.  I just got a letter saying they canceled ours because of lack of payment.  I guess she doesn't care what happens to me.  If I go to jail because of her when I've done nothing wrong, that'll be the straw to break the camel's back, ya know what I mean?

Kids: They are fine.  One is in 1st grade and the other is in day care (which is why we are very close to rock bottom). 

Personal: I been listening to Metallica's new album A LOT.  It kicks so much ass.  I am so happy, too, because the last 3 they had were not so good.  This one is amazing, though.  Some people are bashing it without even listening to it just because of they're last to flops.  They'll come around, though.  I'm sure.  It's number one on the charts now, that's cool.  I knew they could still make awesome, kick ass music.  They were just in a bad place.  That's all behind them now, and it's time to kick ass again.

That's all I got for now.  Later.

Metallica is out with a new CD, Death Magnetic.  I got it last week and have been listing to it like crazy.  I really am please with it.  In a way I haven't been please with a Metallica release since The Black Album.  Here is a breakdown of how I feel about the new CD.

1. That was Just Your Life: Probably my favorite track of this release. A fun, exhilarating blast of energy to kick off their new disc. I knew half way through this song, this CD was special. 10 of 10.

2. The End of the Line: I didn't like the opening riff but it kinda gets catchy after that. Not my favorite on the CD but it's not all bad. 7 of 10.

3. Broken, Beat & Scarred: Again, another catchy tune. I liked the lyrics and the driving force of the rhythm guitar. 7 of 10.

4. The Day That Never Comes: At first I didn't care for the beginning of this one, and was blown away by the middle on through the solo. Upon further listening, though, I've come to understand it more and appreciate it much more. All in all a great tune with Metallica's signature build up from a slow beginning to a fast and furious mid section. An awesome solo at the peak of the fury ties it all in to make for one of the better Metallica songs since Sad But True. 9 of 10.

5. All Nightmare Long: Really like this song, too. The "twang" in the intro is a little annoying but it quickly picks up. The drums in this one (epically in the beginning) are nice. Lyrics are great. I don't like the "Luck Runs Out" thing but the rest are pretty solid. The Solo has some great elements even if it can be erratic at times. Still bad ass. The guitar gets freaking' awesome near the end. 8 of 10.

6. Cyanide: I don't have much to say about this one...probably my second least favorite on this CD. But even it (and my least favorite which is coming up) has some really good parts. 7.5 of 10.

7. The Unforgiven III: I literally rolled my eyes and cringed when I learned there was going to be another "Unforgiven". My first reaction, however, was not justified. It is by far the best of the 3. I don't even want to talk about the second one, what the hell was that? And the first one was okay. This one is really good though. Great beat, great lyrics, great solo, great rhythm, great drums. Proof again that they don't always have to play as fast as possible to be great. It was worth listening to the other 2 "Unforgiven"s to get to this one. 

8. The Judas Kiss: Least favorite of the album...that being said it's still great and it's still better then half the songs on the Load Reload pair. I'll just leave it there, lol. I did like the rhythm guitar during the chorus. 7 of 10

9. Suicide and Redemption: Finally, a good old fashioned Metallica instrumental. Thank you, Metallica. I missed these. Just great fun from beginning to end. Good Times. 8 of 10.

10. My Apocalypse: Second favorite on the CD. Reminds me of "Damage Inc.". A perfect end to the CD in the same respect that "Damage Inc." and "Dyers Eve" were in that it leaves me feeling blown away. And makes me want to start the disc over. Which I usually do. And I start the beautiful journey all over again. 10 of 10.

Over all. Best album since TBA (maybe even better, there's just that "can't compete with memories" thing that makes TBA stand out. Whole album, 9.3 of 10. Thank you Metallica. Please play a concert near Louisville, so I can see you live again.

Got a few new games for the Nin DS.  Got Final Fantasy III DS and My Spanish Teacher.  Both are pretty cool and both are examples of games I wanted the DS for.  So I got those two and Brain Age 2 and Legend of Zelda and a gameboy advanced game Final Fantasy IV.  All are pretty much the reasons I bought it.  I need a few more and I'll be set.

It's been a min...Saw Iron Man, Great movie, saw Indiana Jones, decent movie, going to see Prince Caspian tonight with Jon (I hope). And we're going to get donuts cuz it's donut day.  I gave him his early birthday present today, it had to be early cuz it's the game Metal Gear Solid 4 and it comes out next Friday.  I was afraid he'd go run out and find a way to get it as it's like his favorite game.  I was happy to give a gift to someone they'll really enjoy.  I been playin' Zelda for the DS.  Now that is a pretty fun game.  I'm lookin' into gettin' a Wii but I haven't found one yet, damn Nintendo.  Got the new single from The Cure.  It's called The Only One.  It's pretty good.  I was dissatisfied with they're last album...I am hoping that this one will be better.  Anyway, I gots to go.  Later.

I got my new tattoo. Actually got it last Sat. The day of Thunder Over Louisville. I got a dragon on my arm to cover up the moon that was there. Rick did a great job, it looks awesome. I got the pics from his my space page of the before and after. Before After If you want to check out more of Rick's tattoo work go here http://viewmorepics.myspace.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=user.viewPicture&friendID=98132423&albumId=1494293

sleepy.  couldn't get to sleep last night.  but not for lack of trying.  I'd love to just chill out on the couch all day.  gotta go to work though.  I usually don't mind work...just sleepy as hell.  sister and her family are coming to town from n. carolina at the end of this month.  that ought to be interesting.  I don't have personal days at work yet so I'm not sure if I will be able to spend that much time with them.  that may suck.  oh well.  gotta jet.
Me, Jon, and David lifted a car...See Here <lj-embed id="1" />

Can ya believe it?  I'm actually updating my LJ.   Crazy, eh?  I am going to be starting a new job soon.  Or at least the training for a new job.  Whether I get to work the job or not depends on whether or not I can finish the 3 weeks of training and pass all the tests.  If it all works out though it'll be a better opportunity then my current position offers.  Not much else is going on.  My youngest just turned 2.  We just went to N.C. to visit my sister and her family.  That's all I can think of for now.  I plan to write here if not everyday then at least once a week.  It's been 7 months since I updated.  That's ridicules.  Even if no one ever reads it.  I got the thing...may as well use it, eh?  That's it.  Gotta jet.  Gotta go to work...blah.  Still gotta get the kids ready, finish updating my ipod, get ME ready...now phone is ringing...blah...

I didn't work today because while helping a lady change a tire last night the jack slipped and the car fell on my finger.  It's painful and it has turned purple.  I plan to go to the immediate care center in a few.  Anyway I only got a couple house of sleep last night because of it and I spent the morning sleeping.  In that sleep I dreamed a strange dream.  In this dream I was a scientist of some sort.  An astronomer I believe.  In doing my work my team and I discovered a large asteroid on a path to Earth.  It was actually a binary unit.  There were two asteroids circling eachother.  It was, we knew, a "kill-shot".  In other words it was destined to end life on earth.  We all resigned ourselves to the fact that this was the end.  However, just before the impact I saw a vision that if I found just the right spot on earth I would enter a sort of vortex that would protect me.  I quickly gathered my family into a car and headed for a spot the same vision showed me.  I tried to get as many people as I could to join us.  Unfortunatly only a handfull of people would listen.  We made it to the spot just as the impact occured.  We did escape the danger.  Really the only thing we did was pass through it.  The results were immedate.  On the other side we found a world void of all human life.  Thats about were the dream ended.  I just thought it was strange and wanted to put in down so I wouldn't forget.

I got Final Fantasy XII.  I been playin' it.  I like it alot.  I wish the battle system was more old school but you gotta take what they give, eh?  It's more like the online battle system.  Only I can control the other charecters.  This game is eating into my sleep time.  I'm staying up later these days to play it.  Saw Babel the other day.  Was free sneak preview.  Went with Jon and his pops.  It was only an okay movie.  Well I'm watchin' the baby so I better give her some attention.

Halloween is on it's way.  A great day indeed.  Especially since this year it happens to coincide with the release of Final Fantasy XII.  The long awaited new Final Fantasy game.  I have not not a real FF game to play since FFX came out in Dec. of 2001.  5 years ago.  Now FFXII The online one came out March of 2004 but its online.  It's an MMORPG.  Massive Multiplayer Online Role Playing Game.  Wich means you've no choice but to play it online with others.  Wich I like MMORPG's but not all the time.  And I'm just glad they went back to regular rpg for this one.  I can't wait.
I've just added some pics to My Gallery. Have a gander.

So I got the new Iron Maiden cd last night.  It's pritty damn good.  I almost wish they didn't have the stigma attached to them by having the crazy art, and that mascot, Eddie, and just the whole Iron Maiden stuff.  Cuz I really do think they are very talented and do not get the respect they deserve.  Jon got me Slayer's new cd last week.  It's pritty good too but a bit over the edge.  They're going way outta there way these days to be as "evil" and "anti-christianty" as they can.  I don't care.  I love the drums.  That's my favorite part. 

In honor of it being September 11 (technically it's 12 cuz its past midnight, but whatever) I was going to post the audio of the message Jon left on my machine telling me it was going down.  However, I can't seem to find that piticular answering machine.  I will find it eventually. 

Well...it's nearly 2 am and I gotta work tomorrow and watch the baby in the morning so I guess good night.
Happy Birthday Star Trek. Next Gen was my favorite crew.

We've lost a fellow animal lover. As some of you no doubt already know, today Steve Irwin (The Crocodile Hunter) died after a stingray's barbed tail fatally pierced his heart. Doctors say if it had pierced him any other place other then directly in his heart he most likely wouldn't have died. He was an avid environmentalist and conservationist and there wasn't anything he wouldn't do to help save, protect and stand up for the rights of the beautiful creatures we share this world with. Steve Irwin Feb. 22, 1962-Sept. 4, 2006

Work is all fubared now.  Jon got the boot.  That in and of itself was enough to change work a great deal.  But then there was more.  He then started getting letters from a former employee telling him he got the boot due to a conspiracy by someone who wished for his supervisor posistion.  After all that hit the fan I thought I was gonna get canned too cuz of my close friendship with Jon.  Then I talked to another supervisor there, David, and felt better.  Felt I hadn't been implicated.  Then My name was brought up again.  Then it was fixed.  I don't know.  I wish they hadn't fired Jon but her got a better job and is happier now anyway.  I don't really want to get fired other this shit cuz I got tiny mouths to feed.  And really I didn't do anything...I just don't want my being friends with Jon to make them think I was in need of being canned too.  Cuz we still friends.  And always will be, no matter what.  Well that's all.  I guess I'll know soon enough if all the bullshit will somehow land on me.  Although as I said before it shouldn't cuz I havn't done anything.

Went to the drive in last night with the family.  Went to see Cars and Pirates of the Carribean.  That was sold out and they played Pirates first (sucks when you bring a 4 year old).  So we saw Click and Superman.  Click was okay.  I guess.  Superman is a good movie.  I really wanted to see Pirates though.  Oh well.  At work my bosses are hiding things to see if I'll find them.  For example they hid some bananas.  yes bananas.  And told me they were out there somewhere.  I don't need that shit.  I got enough to worry about without having to be tricked into screwing up at work.  It's like they're making me parenoid.  That's like psycological control or something.  To hell with that.  I don't need that shit.  Espically for what they pay me.  Wife's good.  Kids are doing good.  Emily turns a year old this month.  Abby turns 5 in 5 months.  And next month I'll be 28.  I wish myself through everyday...just to wish to have them back. That's all for now.

'ello.  not alot to speak of.  worked today.  it was okay.  even though no one showed.  i finally got to see corpse bride the other day.  awesome movie.  it's lame i had to wait this long since it was a movie i was really really looking forward to seeing and really really wanted to see it in the theaters.  it's probably one of my favorite movie now.  i've just seen it a few days ago and i've already watched it 3 times.  it's great.  the bone jangles song is great.  anyway.  sorry.  'nough 'bout that.  i really need to be off to bed.  sorry this entry had nothing real in it.  oh well...sometimes that's the hands that life deals ya, ya know.

After you die...
Heaven

After death, you will exist in heaven. Everything and everyone you love will constantly surround you for all of eternity. You lucky scoundrel.
Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com

Today is Memorial Day.  And I actually have the day off...WITH PAY!!!  First time for me to have a day when I could get paid even when i didnt go into work.  Frankly I dont care if I get paid or not...I get 3 freakin days off in a row.  Sweet, a?  Anyway.  We finished our kitchen today and My wife, daughter and even lilly, the puppy went to my inlaws for dinner.  And I didnt have to go.  So I have several hours to myself.  to do as i wish.  course she wants me to mow the lawn...but im not exactly rushing to do that.  Im just sittin round doin nothin.  It kicks ass.  Well, Im off to sit around somewhere else.  Bye.

I cant stand being alone.    And yet i seek out solitude as if it were my old friend.  groups of 2 or more people whom i do not know make me very uncomfortable.  I feel sad when im the only one around and there isnt anyone else to talk to...to hear me complain...to complain to me.  Still I shut myself in my house and wait for the time when the house is asleep.  When I'm alone theres noone to tell me Im wanted.  Needed.  Appriciated.  But then theres noone to complain when something wasnt done; or done correctly.  When there are others I feel compelled to be someone I dont really recognize as me.  Very few people do i feel comfortable enought to be me around.  So few in fact that I can name them right now:  Jon, Melissa, and the people at work-Cloud, kim, Jessica, Kendall, Cathy.  I feel like im letting them down though.  I MUST BE A GROOMER.  I push myself so hard sometimes I feel like Im missing the whole point.  They keep telling me one day it'll all sink in and I'll just "get" it.  I prey to whomever will hear my voice that that day comes soon.  I dont wanna fail again.  I dont wanna let people down.  <<Man did i strey from the point>>  bottom line I feel lonely and yet I dont wanna do anything about it.  Perhaps my need to be alone is a stronger urge then my need to NOT be alone.  Or perhaps I like the isolation.  Perhaps I enjoy it.  Or perhaps I know deep down inside that being alone is far better then feeling uncomfortable around strange new people.  Okay then, Im pritty sure I've rambled on long enough.  Sleepy anyway.  G'nite.

i still recall the taste of your tears echoing your voice just like the ringing in my ears my favorite dreams of you still wash ashore scraping through my head 'till i don't want to sleep anymore you make this all go away you make this all go away i'm down to just one thing and i'm starting to scare myself you make this all go away you make this all go away i just want something i just want something i can never have you always were the one to show me how back then i couldn't do the things that i can do now this thing is slowly taking me apart grey would be the color if i had a heart you make this all go away you make this all go away i'm down to just one thing and i'm starting to scare myself you make this all go away you make this all go away i just want something i just want something i can never have in this place it seems like such a shame though it all looks different now, i know it's still the same everywhere i look you're all i see just a fading fu*king reminder of who i used to be you make this all go away you make this all go away i'm down to just one thing and i'm starting to scare myself you make this all go away you make it all go away i just want something i just want something i can never have i just want something i can never have -Nine Inch Nails-

well it's a new day.  Got a puppy the other day.  She's a mutt.  Her name is Lily.  She's cute.  She's also annoying.  Chewing things up...getting into things she shouldnt be getting into.  But it's all worth it.  Because puppies are great.  Everyone should have a puppy.  Especially a dog groomer.  Im not one yet but hopefully I will be one soon.  And a dog groomer that doesnt have a dog is like a tattoo artist that doesnt have tattoos.  Just dont trust em.  Anyway.  Nothing much to do.  Daughters taking a nap.  Cats are hiding from puppy.  Puppy is probably into something she shouldnt be into.  What fun.  I better get to go do something fun tonight or i just may go crazy.  First I'll have to do my masters bidding.  I'll have to clean this...wash that...build our new hutch...do laundry...all because i got married 5 years ago.  Anyway...i better go pretend i did something constructive...or all i'll be doing tonight is arguing.  Dragon lady comes home in 4 hours.  later.

good morning.  Today i plan to enjoy being off work.  My daughter and i will watch tv all day and except for a trip to the smoke shop and putting in our new toilet im spending the day pritty much on the couch.  Its a rare treat indeed for me to have less then 5 things to do all day.  Im sure there is more i should do...but im not gonna.  Not every day of my life needs to be for getting stuff done.  Im so hungry.  I think im outty so i can go eat something.

Wow.  Finally writing in my LJ again.  Sorry for the deley.  I been real busy latley.  PetsMart job had  me going to Indy for grooming school then when i got back we moved into our new home.  But im starting to settle into the new life more and more each day so I am finding myself with more and more time to do things like update my LJ.  Got cable internet and hopefully will be getting a new pc soon...so I'll be on a hell of a lot more.  I'll get to call myself a dog groomer soon.  That makes me happy and proud of myself.  If it works out I will have actually done something right for the first time in my life.  Thats a big deal for me.  I usually "F"  every thing all up.  Well im really sleepy as hell.  In fact I just fell asleep whilst playing FFXI with my friend.  Poor dude, thats like the second night in a row I did that.  Im just so used to being in bed by 10 or 11 these days.  Sorry Jon, I'll make it up to you.  With that, im going to bed.  night.
